Summary: Brilliant red circular fireball/light spewing sparks from rear
divs: sighting detailsoctober 22, 2008, 5.23 am. while travelling southbound on the morning commute to toronto on the 400 highway, wife witnessed a large bright red, circular light low in the horizon moving north to south. was sighted just south of barrie ontario. the light\object appeared to be streaking over innisfil, or perhaps cookstown. the object\light spewed white and red sparks as it moved. it flashed for a few seconds, then it just winked out as if a light switch had been pulled. observation time total- about fifteen seconds. it was the size of pencil eraser at arms length, and very bright. was it a true uap or a piece of space junk; meteor or otherwise? she would like to know if others saw this uap.
trends: There have been 9 other sightings in Barrie
There was one other sighting in Barrie on or around October 22nd 2008
